code:
import re

def candidate(s):
    # Use regex to replace all whitespace characters (spaces, tabs, newlines) with underscores
    s = re.sub(r'\s', '_', s)
    
    # Then, replace all underscores with whitespace characters followed by any number of non-whitespace characters
    s = re.sub(r'_', r' \S*', s)
    
    return s
explanation:
Explanation
-----------

The error occurs because the character class `\w` includes whitespace characters. This causes an infinite loop when trying to replace underscores with whitespace followed by non-whitespace characters.
